etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of Morphology. From German Mitosoma from mito- + -soma

definitions: An area of a cell in which mitochondria are aggregated (now rare, perhaps obsolete); (later) an organelle in the cytoplasm of certain protozoans that corresponds to a mitochondrion. Also: †a cytoplasmic structure formed by the remains of the mitotic spindle (obsolete).
